convention.translation[0].definitions[0]: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests
a convention for science fiction fans
convention.translation[0].definitions[1]: a formal agreement, especially between countries, about particular rules or behaviour
the European convention on human rights
convention.translation[0].definitions[2]: behaviour and attitudes that most people in a society consider to be normal and right
Playing together teaches children social conventions such as sharing.
They defied the conventions of the time by living together without being married.
By convention, the bride’s father gives her away at her wedding.
convention.translation[0].definitions[3]: a method or style often used in literature, art, the theatre etc to achieve a particular effect
convention.translation[0].note_box[0].he: – Meaning 3: behaviour and attitudes that most people in a society consider to be normal and right
convention.translation[0].note_box[0].se: Each society has its own cultural conventions.
There are established conventions for how you should end a letter.
Saying 'thank you' and 'please' is an accepted convention.
At the time she was defying convention by living with a man.
If everyone followed convention, the world would be a boring place.

In the East you will have to learn a different set of conventions.

convention.translation[1].definitions[0]: behaviour and attitudes that most people in a society believe to be normal and right
convention.translation[1].definitions[1]: a formal agreement, especially between countries, about rules for an activity such as war or trade
The Berne convention requires its signatories to respect copyrights for the life of the author plus 50 years.
convention.translation[1].definitions[2]: a large meeting of people who belong to the same profession or organization, or work in the same industry
